subject: Re: Mock and collections.
msgSnippet: ... I create a general solution for this kind of problem and I will make soon a paper about this. For your specific problem I think in two possible solutions:
messageBody:
--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "sky eagle" <eagle.xiao@...> wrote:

> Creating items is tediously, is there a better solution?

I create a general solution for this kind of problem and I will make
soon a paper about this.
For your specific problem I think in two possible solutions:

First one: You want create a XML document than simply make a String
comparison with the serialization result - just one line of code. [:)]

Second one: If you use XML just as a example and the real "Graph
<http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Graph_theory> " objects is of other king,
than I think in parsers - well, let me explain:
You have a "Graph" of objects, this mean that you have one object
connected in other and this object connected in other and so on.
Probably you need access some object in this "Graph"; when is needed
access this object you will have chance to test it . A example is more
explanatory:

Suppose I will access a budget object; a real budget will have a lot of
objects connected to it, this is a "Graph". Make a test to know if the
root object is correct, check yours attributes and no more. Right now I
don't care about others objects in this "Graph".

Suppose now that I need access some product inside of the list product.
This will use the first code - a kind of service; I know that I have the
correct budget, now I need know if this budget have the correct first
product - now I need access it. I will make a test to know if this
product is correct.

In this explanation I make unitary test step-by-step, walking on the
"Graph" when needed.

I expected that you have understood what I want tell. My paper will be
more clear. [;)] Sorry about my poor English.







[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
